Gates.description: Pauli X gate (π rotation over X-axis) classical computing equivalent: "NOT" gate.
Pauli Y gate (π rotation over Y-axis) classical computing equivalent: "NOT" gate.
Pauli Z gate (π rotation over Z-axis) classical computing equivalent: "NOT" gate.
RX (Rotated Pauli X gate) is a single-qubit rotation through an angle of π/2 around the x-axis.
RY (Rotated Pauli Y gate) is a single-qubit rotation through an angle of π/2 around the y-axis.
RZ (Rotated Pauli Z gate) is a single-qubit rotation through an angle of π/2 around the z-axis.
One qubit rotation, mapping the two qubit- basis states to two superposition states.
CNOT or (Controlled Pauli-X) acts on 2 or more qubits.
Used to observe the quantum state.
